answers.answer: Hello,The normal post prandial blood sugar should be less than 140 mg/dl .The consequences of diabetes mellitus are glycogen deposition,steatosis and nonalcoholic steatohepatitis ,fibrosis and cirrhosis.Hepatic fat accumulation is a well-recognized complication of diabetes seen in almost more than 50% diabetics. You seem to be suffering from nonalcoholic fatty liver disease, which is due to obesity, diabetes and high triglyceride levels. Lifestyle changes may be helpful. You should refrain from taking alcohol, as this will cause further injury to the liver. Hemoglobin A1c provides an average of your blood sugar control over a six to 12 week period and should be used in conjunction with home blood sugar monitoring for making adjustments in your diabetes medicines. Diabetes should be treated and control obesity..Adopt lifestyle changes like weight reduction, exercise etc. Indulge in exercise daily and avoid fried fatty foods.
